Questions.QuestionString: Which computer controls the engine thrust?
Answers: EEC in both manual and automatic thrust modes
FMGC in automatic thrust mode and ECU in manual mode
FCU in both manual and automatic thrust modes

Questions.QuestionString: When the throttle is between two detent points, what position corresponds to the thrust limit?
What is the normal engine throttle cruise detent point?

Answers: Throttle control lever, throttle control artificial feel unit, throttle control unit, electrical harness
Throttle control lever, throttle control artificial feel unit, throttle control unit, electrical harness, EGT thermocouple
Throttle control lever, throttle control artificial feel unit, electrical harness

Questions.QuestionString: In case of overspeed, EEC will control:
Answers: Thrust Control Malfunction (TCM)/Overspeed TM in IFPC
FDR to stop the fuel in the combustion chamber

Questions.QuestionString: In case of TCM (Thrust Control Malfunction) on ground, the fuel shut-off valve will be controlled in:
In case of TCM (Thrust Control Malfunction) in flight, the fuel shut-off valve will be controlled in:
In case of the event of Thrust control malfunction (TCM) on ground:
Answers: There is no protection, the Thrust lever must be moved forward manually
The Engine master switch switches off immediately
